title: Your Pictures in Wales: 15-21 February 2017
text: A weekly selection of your pictures from around Wales. Sam Rean Sam Rean photographed Layla enjoying a day at Newport Sands in Pembrokeshire. Would you like to see your picture featured? Send it to newsonlinepictures@bbc.co.uk with your details and information about how you came to take the photograph. Iwan Williams Iwan Williams captured this gorgeous image of the purple sky over Llyn Padarn, Snowdonia. David Crawford David Crawford took this image of the magical dawn sky above Moel Famau, Mold. Shannon Price Sunset over the sea: Llanddwyn Island lighthouse taken by Shannon Price. Mel Bloor-Steen Seagulls secure their places on the beach at Llandudno, taken by Mel Bloor-Steen. Rhys Evans Rhossili Bay, Gower, courtesy of Rhys Evans from Cardiff while on a family walk. Susan Beer Spring has sprung: Susan Beer captured these daffodils overlooking Langland Bay, Gower. Martyn Jenkins This picture of Cardiff Bay was taken by Martyn Jenkins, who thought the Wales Millennium Centre looked like golden fish scales. Richard Cave Richard Cave snapped this view of Llyn Lluncaws in the Berwyn Mountains, Denbighshire, on a cold morning. Marie Jones Silver, a slate merle border collie, relaxing on the Blorenge near Abergavenny, Monmouthshire, during walk with owner Marie Jones. Bleddyn Jones-Pearson The Gorsedd stone and Menai Bridge at twilight, as captured by Bleddyn Jones-Pearson. Phil Dascombe This incredible sunset was taken by Phil Dascombe near the River Ogmore looking toward Ogmore and Merthyr Mawr, Bridgend county.
